game_input.desc01: Freshly roasted coffee will remain usable for up to 9 days, provided the beans are kept dry, cool and away from the light.

game_input.expert_01: The short black serves as the foundational element of espresso-based beverages, executed with precision to yield a robust shot.
game_input.expert_02: Ristretto, characterized by its restricted extraction, intensifies the espresso experience through a concentrated flavor profile.
game_input.expert_03: In crafting a long black, the technique of layering espresso atop hot water is pivotal in preserving the crema, enhancing aromatic presence.
game_input.expert_04: The Americano distinguishes itself by a nuanced dilution process, where crema preservation becomes challenging due to increased surface area.
game_input.expert_05: Macchiato, with its nuanced addition of hot milk, subtly modulates the espresso's intensity, introducing a textural contrast.
game_input.school_01: A short black is a simple espresso shot served in a small cup.
game_input.school_02: Ristretto is a stronger, more concentrated espresso shot, made by using less water.
game_input.school_03: A long black involves pouring espresso over hot water in a larger cup, keeping the foam on top.
game_input.school_04: An Americano is similar to a long black but is made in an even larger cup and might lose some foam.
game_input.school_05: A macchiato is an espresso 'marked' with a little bit of hot milk on top.

game.label: Teach it to me
game.short_description: Learn in 5 sentences or less!

game_input.expert_01: Regular maintenance protocols for espresso machines emphasize the necessity for routine cleaning of integral components such as the drip tray, grinder, and periodic comprehensive servicing biannually.
game_input.expert_02: Diagnostic steps for common issues include rectification strategies for under-extraction and over-extraction of espresso shots, mitigating loss of steam pressure under high operational demand, and detailed cleaning processes for the coffee handles, steam arms, and group head.
game_input.expert_03: It's imperative to understand the granularity of grind settings, which significantly influence extraction quality, and to utilize the Mazzer Grinder user manual for optimal adjustment.
game_input.expert_04: Professional servicing intervals are critical in maintaining the espresso machine's performance, aiming to preemptively address wear and tear before operational efficiency is compromised.
game_input.expert_05: Troubleshooting procedures extend beyond superficial cleaning, requiring a nuanced understanding of mechanical and extraction processes to ensure the espresso machine operates within its ideal parameters.
game_input.school_01: It's important to clean your coffee machine regularly, like wiping down the parts where coffee drips and the place where coffee is ground.
game_input.school_02: Every 6 months, you should get a professional to check your coffee machine to make sure everything is working right.
game_input.school_03: If your coffee isn't tasting right, it might be because it's either not brewed long enough or brewed too long, or your machine might need a good cleaning.
game_input.school_04: Sometimes, if you use your coffee machine a lot at once, it might not make steam as well. It's a sign it needs some care.
game_input.school_05: There are guides and tips on how to adjust the grinder for your coffee to taste perfect and how to use specific grinders like the Mazzer.

game.label: Teach it to me
game.short_description: Learn in 5 sentences or less!

game_input.expert_01: Espresso extraction is a precise process involving dosing, tamping, and percolation, aiming for optimal flavor compounds extraction.
game_input.expert_02: Uniform tamping is crucial for achieving an even extraction, preventing channeling and ensuring a balanced espresso shot.
game_input.expert_03: The hallmark of a well-extracted espresso is characterized by a caramel-brown crema, indicative of proper emulsion of coffee oils.
game_input.expert_04: Analyzing extraction issues, such as under or over-extraction, is essential for troubleshooting and refining the espresso brewing technique.
game_input.expert_05: Regular maintenance, including cleaning of group heads, steam wands, and portafilters, is vital for the espresso machine's longevity and performance consistency.
game_input.school_01: Making espresso involves measuring the coffee, pressing it down, and then pushing hot water through it to get your drink.
game_input.school_02: Pressing the coffee down evenly is super important so that the water can go through it just right and make a tasty espresso.
game_input.school_03: When making espresso, the coffee should look like rich, dark brown foam on top, which shows it's been made well.
game_input.school_04: If your espresso doesn't taste right, it could be because the water went through the coffee too fast or too slow.
game_input.school_05: Keeping the espresso machine clean, like washing the parts where coffee and milk go, helps it work better and makes the coffee taste good.

game_input.expert_01: Expertise in barista skills is pivotal for a cafe's market position, directly influencing its commercial viability.
game_input.expert_02: Incompetent staff members serving subpar coffee catalyze reputational damage, undermining the establishment's financial success.
game_input.expert_03: Our espresso training program is bespoke, catering to differing skill levels, from novice to advanced practitioners, ensuring comprehensive skill acquisition.
game_input.expert_04: Continuous professional development in coffee crafting is integral to a cafe's operational ethos, sustaining its competitive edge.
game_input.expert_05: Embedding an ethos of perpetual skill enhancement in barista practices is fundamental to fostering a culture of excellence within cafe operations.
game_input.school_01: Having good baristas is super important for a cafe to do well because they make the coffee.
game_input.school_02: If the staff isn't good at making coffee, the cafe might get a bad reputation and lose customers.
game_input.school_03: The cafe offers special training for beginners and also for those who already know how to make coffee but want to get better.
game_input.school_04: Learning how to make great coffee is something that never stops; it keeps going to make sure the cafe stays successful.
game_input.school_05: Being part of a successful cafe means always learning and improving how to make coffee, it's part of the cafe's way of doing things.

game_input.expert_01: Celcius Coffee ensures a supply of premium, 100% organic, fairtrade licensed coffee, adhering to ethical sourcing standards.
game_input.expert_02: Optimal flavor profiles in freshly roasted coffee are achieved within a 7 to 10-day post-roasting window, highlighting the importance of timely consumption.
game_input.expert_03: Prevent oxidation and flavor degradation by grinding coffee beans immediately prior to brewing, maintaining peak freshness.
game_input.expert_04: For preservation, coffee beans should be stored under conditions mitigating oxidative and moisture-related deterioration, specifically in cool, dark, and airtight environments.
game_input.expert_05: Daily removal of beans from the grinder hopper to an airtight container is recommended to prevent stale flavors, emphasizing best practices in coffee storage.
game_input.school_01: Celcius Coffee promises to give you only the best fresh and organic coffee that's fair to farmers.
game_input.school_02: Your coffee tastes best 7 to 10 days after it's been roasted, so that's when you should enjoy it.
game_input.school_03: Grind your coffee beans right before you use them, or they'll get stale because of the air.
game_input.school_04: Keep your coffee beans in a cool, dark place in a tight container to keep them fresh.
game_input.school_05: Don't leave beans in the grinder; put them in an airtight container overnight to stay fresh.

game_input.expert_01: Optimal espresso quality is maintained by using freshly roasted beans within a 9-day post-roast window, emphasizing the importance of storage conditions to preserve bean integrity.
game_input.expert_02: Grind-on-demand practices are critical for preserving coffee's volatile compounds, highlighting the rapid degradation of flavor post-grinding.
game_input.expert_03: Hygiene protocols are paramount in coffee preparation, equating the necessity of cleanliness with that of food safety standards to prevent flavor contamination.
game_input.expert_04: Thermal management of all elements involved in espresso extraction, from water to the serving cup, is essential for maintaining the beverage's temperature and flavor profile.
game_input.expert_05: Efficiency in preparation coupled with consistency in product quality forms the foundation of customer retention in the coffee service industry.
game_input.school_01: To keep your coffee tasting great, use beans that have been roasted within the last 9 days, and keep them dry and away from light.
game_input.school_02: Always grind your coffee right before you use it, because once it's ground, it starts to lose its good flavor really fast.
game_input.school_03: Just like food, everything that touches your coffee or coffee machine needs to be clean to avoid any bad tastes.
game_input.school_04: Make sure the water, milk, and even the cup you serve the coffee in are hot, so the coffee stays warm and tasty.
game_input.school_05: Serving coffee quickly and consistently good will make your customers want to come back for more.
